main event: A radar observation detected a single unidentified object over Oakwood, Ohio on November 22, 1957.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 16 minutes., The object was tracked by radar and had a possible red glow., It was described as slightly larger than the size of a head of a pin or pea., The object's brightness diminished as it moved slowly north., Comments suggested the object could have been an astronomical phenomenon, possibly Venus.
sighted object: one unidentified object with a possible red glow
witness description: AF Officials reported the observation but no specific witness details were provided.
